channel.title: Comments on: Corona Geek #78 – Coronium Project, Parse, and Cloud Computing

item.title: By: search
item.dc:creator: search
item.description: Do you have any video of that? I'd love to find out more details.
item.content:encoded:
Do you have any video of that? I’d love to
find out more details.

item.title: By: Chris
item.dc:creator: Chris
item.description: Coronium is built on an open source stack, but will Coronium itself be open source?
item.content:encoded: Coronium is built on an open source stack, but will Coronium itself be open source?

item.title: By: develephant
item.dc:creator: develephant
item.description:
Hi David,
I'd be happy to boot up an instance if you're interested. Please drop a line in the Coronium Google Group so I can email you your credentials.
Cheers, Chris.
item.content:encoded:
Hi David,

I’d be happy to boot up an instance if you’re interested. Please drop a line in the Coronium Google Group so I can email you your credentials.

Cheers,
Chris.

item.title: By: Charles McKeever
item.dc:creator: Charles McKeever
item.description:
Coronium is in private alpha. So, you'll need to join the Coronium Google Group and ask to become a tester. The link is on the wiki homepage and bottom left sidebar, but it's not obvious.
Here's the group link, https://groups.google.com/forum/?hl=en#!forum/coronium-cloud-platform
Chris is very responsive, just keep in mind that he is a one persona show in terms of staff and resources :)
item.content:encoded:
Coronium is in private alpha. So, you’ll need to join the Coronium Google Group and ask to become a tester. The link is on the wiki homepage and bottom left sidebar, but it’s not obvious.

Here’s the group link, https://groups.google.com/forum/?hl=en#!forum/coronium-cloud-platform

Chris is very responsive, just keep in mind that he is a one persona show in terms of staff and resources ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: David MEKERSA
item.dc:creator: David MEKERSA
item.description: Really excited but Coronium. Despite some search, I'm not sure to understand how to test it. There is no "Download" button on the wiki and the screencast show some system with already installed Coronium components. Did I miss something? Should I subscribe to a beta program?
item.content:encoded:
Really excited but Coronium.
Despite some search, I’m not sure to understand how to test it. There is no “Download” button on the wiki and the screencast show some system with already installed Coronium components. Did I miss something? Should I subscribe to a beta program?
